brief_summary.textblock:
1. recruit 50 patients with atrial fibrillation and 30 controls

        2. endovascular function assessment with Peripheral Arterial Tonometry (PAT)

        3. follow up the occurence of AF

clinical_study.brief_title: Endovascular Function in Atrial Fibrillation (AF) Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ≥2 paroxysmal (electrocardiographic documentation of at least 1) AF episodes lasting
             ≥1 hour in duration: (that terminate spontaneously within 7 days or cardioversion is
             performed within 48h of AF onset): or

          -  electrocardiographic documentation of 1 persistent AF episode: (sustained for ≥7 days
             or cardioversion is performed more than 48h after AF onset): or

          -  electrocardiographic documentation of 1 longstanding persistent AF episode:
             (continuous AF of duration >1 year).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with cerebralvascular disease

          -  patients with coronary disease

          -  patients with peripheric artery disease

clinical_study.official_title: Endovascular Function in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation

oversight_info.authority: China: Beijing Municipal Science and Technology Commission

primary_outcome.description: The method to assess the endovascular function is PAT. The index is Reactive hyperemia index (RHI). RHI between patients and control will be compared.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: We will do the multi-logistic analysis of the recurrence of AF.
secondary_outcome.measure: predictive effect of endovascular function on recurrence of AF

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
